5. The role of steroids in acute infectious encephalitis is debatable. There are theoretical arguments for and against their use. On the one hand, a life-threatening rise in intracranial tension may be relieved by steroids; on the other hand, there is a risk of flaring-up of viral infection with steroids. A study that evaluated high-dose dexamethasone in JE found no benefit of steroid therapy
